db:abstract.db:para: The QTextStream class provides a convenient interface for reading and writing text.

db:note.db:para: All functions in this class are reentrant.

db:listitem.db:para: QTextStream is part of Input/Output and Networkingstring-processing

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: QTextStream can operate on a QIODevice, a QByteArray or a QString. Using QTextStream's streaming operators, you can conveniently read and write words, lines and numbers. For generating text, QTextStream supports formatting options for field padding and alignment, and formatting of numbers. Example:
It's also common to use QTextStream to read console input and write console output. QTextStream is locale aware, and will automatically decode standard input using the correct codec. Example:

Besides using QTextStream's constructors, you can also set the device or string QTextStream operates on by calling setDevice() or setString(). You can seek to a position by calling seek(), and atEnd() will return true when there is no data left to be read. If you call flush(), QTextStream will empty all data from its write buffer into the device and call flush() on the device.

Internally, QTextStream uses a Unicode based buffer, and QTextCodec is used by QTextStream to automatically support different character sets. By default, QTextCodec::codecForLocale() is used for reading and writing, but you can also set the codec by calling setCodec(). Automatic Unicode detection is also supported. When this feature is enabled (the default behavior), QTextStream will detect the UTF-16 or the UTF-32 BOM (Byte Order Mark) and switch to the appropriate UTF codec when reading. QTextStream does not write a BOM by default, but you can enable this by calling setGenerateByteOrderMark(true). When QTextStream operates on a QString directly, the codec is disabled.
There are three general ways to use QTextStream when reading text files:

db:listitem.db:para: Chunk by chunk, by calling readLine() or readAll().
Word by word. QTextStream supports streaming into QStrings, QByteArrays and char* buffers. Words are delimited by space, and leading white space is automatically skipped.

Character by character, by streaming into QChar or char types. This method is often used for convenient input handling when parsing files, independent of character encoding and end-of-line semantics. To skip white space, call skipWhiteSpace().

db:section.db:para: Since the text stream uses a buffer, you should not read from the stream using the implementation of a superclass. For instance, if you have a QFile and read from it directly using QFile::readLine() instead of using the stream, the text stream's internal position will be out of sync with the file's position.

By default, when reading numbers from a stream of text, QTextStream will automatically detect the number's base representation. For example, if the number starts with "0x", it is assumed to be in hexadecimal form. If it starts with the digits 1-9, it is assumed to be in decimal form, and so on. You can set the integer base, thereby disabling the automatic detection, by calling setIntegerBase(). Example:

QTextStream supports many formatting options for generating text. You can set the field width and pad character by calling setFieldWidth() and setPadChar(). Use setFieldAlignment() to set the alignment within each field. For real numbers, call setRealNumberNotation() and setRealNumberPrecision() to set the notation (SmartNotation, ScientificNotation, FixedNotation) and precision in digits of the generated number. Some extra number formatting options are also available through setNumberFlags().
Like <iostream> in the standard C++ library, QTextStream also defines several global manipulator functions:
In addition, Qt provides three global manipulators that take a parameter: qSetFieldWidth(), qSetPadChar(), and qSetRealNumberPrecision().

db:section.db:title: enum QTextStream::FieldAlignment
db:section.db:para: This enum specifies how to align text in fields when the field is wider than the text that occupies it.

db:td.db:para: Pad on the right side of fields.
Pad on the left side of fields.
Pad on both sides of field.
Same as AlignRight, except that the sign of a number is flush left.

db:section.db:title: enum QTextStream::NumberFlag
db:section.db:para: This enum specifies various flags that can be set to affect the output of integers, floats, and doubles.

db:td.db:para: Show the base as a prefix if the base is 16 ("0x"), 8 ("0"), or 2 ("0b").
Always put the decimal separator in numbers, even if there are no decimals.
Always put the sign in numbers, even for positive numbers.
Use uppercase versions of base prefixes ("0X", "0B").
Use uppercase letters for expressing digits 10 to 35 instead of lowercase.

db:section.db:para: The NumberFlags type is a typedef for QFlags<NumberFlag>. It stores an OR combination of NumberFlag values.

db:section.db:title: enum QTextStream::RealNumberNotation
db:section.db:para: This enum specifies which notations to use for expressing float and double as strings.

db:td.db:para: Scientific or fixed-point notation, depending on which makes most sense (printf()'s %g flag).

db:section.db:title: enum QTextStream::Status
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the current status of the text stream.

db:td.db:para: The text stream is operating normally.
The text stream has read past the end of the data in the underlying device.
The text stream has read corrupt data.
The text stream cannot write to the underlying device.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream::QTextStream()
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QTextStream. Before you can use it for reading or writing, you must assign a device or a string.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QTextStream::QTextStream(QIODevice *device)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QTextStream that operates on device.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QTextStream::QTextStream(FILE *fileHandle, QIODevice::OpenMode openMode = QIODevice::ReadWrite)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QTextStream that operates on fileHandle, using openMode to define the open mode. Internally, a QFile is created to handle the FILE pointer.
This constructor is useful for working directly with the common FILE based input and output streams: stdin, stdout and stderr. Example:

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QTextStream::QTextStream(QString *string, QIODevice::OpenMode openMode = QIODevice::ReadWrite)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QTextStream that operates on string, using openMode to define the open mode.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QTextStream::QTextStream(QByteArray *array, QIODevice::OpenMode openMode = QIODevice::ReadWrite)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QTextStream that operates on array, using openMode to define the open mode. Internally, the array is wrapped by a QBuffer.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QTextStream::QTextStream(const QByteArray &array, QIODevice::OpenMode openMode = QIODevice::ReadOnly)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QTextStream that operates on array, using openMode to define the open mode. The array is accessed as read-only, regardless of the values in openMode.
This constructor is convenient for working on constant strings. Example:

db:section.db:title: [virtual] QTextStream::~QTextStream()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the QTextStream.
If the stream operates on a device, flush() will be called implicitly. Otherwise, the device is unaffected.

db:section.db:title: bool QTextStream::atEnd() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if there is no more data to be read from the QTextStream; otherwise returns false. This is similar to, but not the same as calling QIODevice::atEnd(), as QTextStream also takes into account its internal Unicode buffer.

db:section.db:title: bool QTextStream::autoDetectUnicode() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if automatic Unicode detection is enabled, otherwise returns false. Automatic Unicode detection is enabled by default.

db:section.db:title: QTextCodec *QTextStream::codec() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the codec that is current assigned to the stream.

db:section.db:title: QIODevice *QTextStream::device() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current device associated with the QTextStream, or 0 if no device has been assigned.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream::FieldAlignment QTextStream::fieldAlignment() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current field alignment.

db:section.db:title: int QTextStream::fieldWidth() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current field width.

db:section.db:title: void QTextStream::flush()
db:section.db:para: Flushes any buffered data waiting to be written to the device.
If QTextStream operates on a string, this function does nothing.

db:section.db:title: bool QTextStream::generateByteOrderMark() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if QTextStream is set to generate the UTF BOM (Byte Order Mark) when using a UTF codec; otherwise returns false. UTF BOM generation is set to false by default.

db:section.db:title: int QTextStream::integerBase() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current base of integers. 0 means that the base is detected when reading, or 10 (decimal) when generating numbers.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.5] QLocale QTextStream::locale() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the locale for this stream. The default locale is C.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.5.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream::NumberFlags QTextStream::numberFlags() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current number flags.

db:section.db:title: QChar QTextStream::padChar() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current pad character.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.2] qint64 QTextStream::pos() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the device position corresponding to the current position of the stream, or -1 if an error occurs (e.g., if there is no device or string, or if there's a device error).

Because QTextStream is buffered, this function may have to seek the device to reconstruct a valid device position. This operation can be expensive, so you may want to avoid calling this function in a tight loop.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.2.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.1] QString QTextStream::read(qint64 maxlen)
db:section.db:para: Reads at most maxlen characters from the stream, and returns the data read as a QString.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.1.

db:section.db:title: QString QTextStream::readAll()
db:section.db:para: Reads the entire content of the stream, and returns it as a QString. Avoid this function when working on large files, as it will consume a significant amount of memory.
Calling readLine() is better if you do not know how much data is available.

db:section.db:title: QString QTextStream::readLine(qint64 maxlen = 0)
db:section.db:para: Reads one line of text from the stream, and returns it as a QString. The maximum allowed line length is set to maxlen. If the stream contains lines longer than this, then the lines will be split after maxlen characters and returned in parts.
If maxlen is 0, the lines can be of any length.
The returned line has no trailing end-of-line characters ("\n" or "\r\n"), so calling QString::trimmed() can be unnecessary.
If the stream has read to the end of the file, readLine() will return a null QString. For strings, or for devices that support it, you can explicitly test for the end of the stream using atEnd().

db:section.db:title: [since 5.5] bool QTextStream::readLineInto(QString *line, qint64 maxlen = 0)
db:section.db:para: Reads one line of text from the stream into line. If line is 0, the read line is not stored.
The maximum allowed line length is set to maxlen. If the stream contains lines longer than this, then the lines will be split after maxlen characters and returned in parts.
If maxlen is 0, the lines can be of any length.
The resulting line has no trailing end-of-line characters ("\n" or "\r\n"), so calling QString::trimmed() can be unnecessary.
If line has sufficient capacity for the data that is about to be read, this function may not need to allocate new memory. Because of this, it can be faster than readLine().
Returns false if the stream has read to the end of the file or an error has occurred; otherwise returns true. The contents in line before the call are discarded in any case.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream::RealNumberNotation QTextStream::realNumberNotation() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current real number notation.

db:section.db:title: int QTextStream::realNumberPrecision() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current real number precision, or the number of fraction digits QTextStream will write when generating real numbers.

db:section.db:title: void QTextStream::reset()
db:section.db:para: Resets QTextStream's formatting options, bringing it back to its original constructed state. The device, string and any buffered data is left untouched.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.1] void QTextStream::resetStatus()
db:section.db:para: Resets the status of the text stream.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.1.

db:section.db:title: bool QTextStream::seek(qint64 pos)
db:section.db:para: Seeks to the position pos in the device. Returns true on success; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: void QTextStream::setAutoDetectUnicode(bool enabled)
db:section.db:para: If enabled is true, QTextStream will attempt to detect Unicode encoding by peeking into the stream data to see if it can find the UTF-8, UTF-16, or UTF-32 Byte Order Mark (BOM). If this mark is found, QTextStream will replace the current codec with the UTF codec.
This function can be used together with setCodec(). It is common to set the codec to UTF-8, and then enable UTF-16 detection.

db:section.db:title: void QTextStream::setCodec(QTextCodec *codec)
db:section.db:para: Sets the codec for this stream to codec. The codec is used for decoding any data that is read from the assigned device, and for encoding any data that is written. By default, QTextCodec::codecForLocale() is used, and automatic unicode detection is enabled.
If QTextStream operates on a string, this function does nothing.

db:warning.db:para: If you call this function while the text stream is reading from an open sequential socket, the internal buffer may still contain text decoded using the old codec.

db:section.db:title: void QTextStream::setCodec(const char *codecName)
db:section.db:para: Sets the codec for this stream to the QTextCodec for the encoding specified by codecName. Common values for codecName include "ISO 8859-1", "UTF-8", and "UTF-16". If the encoding isn't recognized, nothing happens.
Example:

db:section.db:title: void QTextStream::setDevice(QIODevice *device)
db:section.db:para: Sets the current device to device. If a device has already been assigned, QTextStream will call flush() before the old device is replaced.

db:note.db:para: This function resets locale to the default locale ('C') and codec to the default codec, QTextCodec::codecForLocale().

db:section.db:title: void QTextStream::setFieldAlignment(QTextStream::FieldAlignment mode)
db:section.db:para: Sets the field alignment to mode. When used together with setFieldWidth(), this function allows you to generate formatted output with text aligned to the left, to the right or center aligned.

db:section.db:title: void QTextStream::setFieldWidth(int width)
db:section.db:para: Sets the current field width to width. If width is 0 (the default), the field width is equal to the length of the generated text.

db:note.db:para: The field width applies to every element appended to this stream after this function has been called (e.g., it also pads endl). This behavior is different from similar classes in the STL, where the field width only applies to the next element.

db:section.db:title: void QTextStream::setGenerateByteOrderMark(bool generate)
db:section.db:para: If generate is true and a UTF codec is used, QTextStream will insert the BOM (Byte Order Mark) before any data has been written to the device. If generate is false, no BOM will be inserted. This function must be called before any data is written. Otherwise, it does nothing.

db:section.db:title: void QTextStream::setIntegerBase(int base)
db:section.db:para: Sets the base of integers to base, both for reading and for generating numbers. base can be either 2 (binary), 8 (octal), 10 (decimal) or 16 (hexadecimal). If base is 0, QTextStream will attempt to detect the base by inspecting the data on the stream. When generating numbers, QTextStream assumes base is 10 unless the base has been set explicitly.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.5] void QTextStream::setLocale(const QLocale &locale)
db:section.db:para: Sets the locale for this stream to locale. The specified locale is used for conversions between numbers and their string representations.
The default locale is C and it is a special case - the thousands group separator is not used for backward compatibility reasons.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.5.

db:section.db:title: void QTextStream::setNumberFlags(QTextStream::NumberFlags flags)
db:section.db:para: Sets the current number flags to flags. flags is a set of flags from the NumberFlag enum, and describes options for formatting generated code (e.g., whether or not to always write the base or sign of a number).

db:section.db:title: void QTextStream::setPadChar(QChar ch)
db:section.db:para: Sets the pad character to ch. The default value is the ASCII space character (' '), or QChar(0x20). This character is used to fill in the space in fields when generating text.
Example:
The string s contains:

db:section.db:title: void QTextStream::setRealNumberNotation(QTextStream::RealNumberNotation notation)
db:section.db:para: Sets the real number notation to notation (SmartNotation, FixedNotation, ScientificNotation). When reading and generating numbers, QTextStream uses this value to detect the formatting of real numbers.

db:section.db:title: void QTextStream::setRealNumberPrecision(int precision)
db:section.db:para: Sets the precision of real numbers to precision. This value describes the number of fraction digits QTextStream should write when generating real numbers.
The precision cannot be a negative value. The default value is 6.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.1] void QTextStream::setStatus(QTextStream::Status status)
db:section.db:para: Sets the status of the text stream to the status given.
Subsequent calls to setStatus() are ignored until resetStatus() is called.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.1.

db:section.db:title: void QTextStream::setString(QString *string, QIODevice::OpenMode openMode = QIODevice::ReadWrite)
db:section.db:para: Sets the current string to string, using the given openMode. If a device has already been assigned, QTextStream will call flush() before replacing it.

db:section.db:title: void QTextStream::skipWhiteSpace()
db:section.db:para: Reads and discards whitespace from the stream until either a non-space character is detected, or until atEnd() returns true. This function is useful when reading a stream character by character.
Whitespace characters are all characters for which QChar::isSpace() returns true.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream::Status QTextStream::status() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the status of the text stream.

db:section.db:title: QString *QTextStream::string() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current string assigned to the QTextStream, or 0 if no string has been assigned.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator<<(QChar c)
db:section.db:para: Writes the character c to the stream, then returns a reference to the QTextStream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator<<(char c)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Converts c from ASCII to a QChar, then writes it to the stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator<<(short i)
db:section.db:para: Writes the integer number i to the stream, then returns a reference to the QTextStream. By default, the number is stored in decimal form, but you can also set the base by calling setIntegerBase().

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator<<(unsigned short i)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Writes the unsigned short i to the stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator<<(int i)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Writes the signed int i to the stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator<<(unsigned int i)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Writes the unsigned int i to the stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator<<(long i)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Writes the signed long i to the stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator<<(unsigned long i)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Writes the unsigned long i to the stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator<<(qlonglong i)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Writes the qlonglong i to the stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator<<(qulonglong i)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Writes the qulonglong i to the stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator<<(float f)
db:section.db:para: Writes the real number f to the stream, then returns a reference to the QTextStream. By default, QTextStream stores it using SmartNotation, with up to 6 digits of precision. You can change the textual representation QTextStream will use for real numbers by calling setRealNumberNotation(), setRealNumberPrecision() and setNumberFlags().

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator<<(double f)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Writes the double f to the stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator<<(const QString &string)
db:section.db:para: Writes the string string to the stream, and returns a reference to the QTextStream. The string is first encoded using the assigned codec (the default codec is QTextCodec::codecForLocale()) before it is written to the stream.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.12] QTextStream &QTextStream::operator<<(QStringView string)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Writes string to the stream, and returns a reference to the QTextStream.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.12.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator<<(QLatin1String string)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Writes string to the stream, and returns a reference to the QTextStream.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.6] QTextStream &QTextStream::operator<<(const QStringRef &string)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Writes string to the stream, and returns a reference to the QTextStream.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.6.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator<<(const QByteArray &array)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Writes array to the stream. The contents of array are converted with QString::fromUtf8().

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator<<(const char *string)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Writes the constant string pointed to by string to the stream. string is assumed to be in ISO-8859-1 encoding. This operator is convenient when working with constant string data. Example:
Warning: QTextStream assumes that string points to a string of text, terminated by a '\0' character. If there is no terminating '\0' character, your application may crash.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator<<(const void *ptr)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Writes ptr to the stream as a hexadecimal number with a base.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator>>(QChar &c)
db:section.db:para: Reads a character from the stream and stores it in c. Returns a reference to the QTextStream, so several operators can be nested. Example:
Whitespace is not skipped.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator>>(char &c)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Reads a character from the stream and stores it in c. The character from the stream is converted to ISO-5589-1 before it is stored.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator>>(short &i)
db:section.db:para: Reads an integer from the stream and stores it in i, then returns a reference to the QTextStream. The number is cast to the correct type before it is stored. If no number was detected on the stream, i is set to 0.
By default, QTextStream will attempt to detect the base of the number using the following rules:
By calling setIntegerBase(), you can specify the integer base explicitly. This will disable the auto-detection, and speed up QTextStream slightly.
Leading whitespace is skipped.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator>>(unsigned short &i)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Stores the integer in the unsigned short i.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator>>(int &i)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Stores the integer in the signed int i.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator>>(unsigned int &i)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Stores the integer in the unsigned int i.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator>>(long &i)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Stores the integer in the signed long i.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator>>(unsigned long &i)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Stores the integer in the unsigned long i.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator>>(qlonglong &i)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Stores the integer in the qlonglong i.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator>>(qulonglong &i)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Stores the integer in the qulonglong i.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator>>(float &f)
db:section.db:para: Reads a real number from the stream and stores it in f, then returns a reference to the QTextStream. The number is cast to the correct type. If no real number is detect on the stream, f is set to 0.0.
As a special exception, QTextStream allows the strings "nan" and "inf" to represent NAN and INF floats or doubles.
Leading whitespace is skipped.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator>>(double &f)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Stores the real number in the double f.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator>>(QString &str)
db:section.db:para: Reads a word from the stream and stores it in str, then returns a reference to the stream. Words are separated by whitespace (i.e., all characters for which QChar::isSpace() returns true).
Leading whitespace is skipped.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator>>(QByteArray &array)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Converts the word to ISO-8859-1, then stores it in array.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &QTextStream::operator>>(char *c)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Stores the word in c, terminated by a '\0' character. If no word is available, only the '\0' character is stored.

Warning: Although convenient, this operator is dangerous and must be used with care. QTextStream assumes that c points to a buffer with enough space to hold the word. If the buffer is too small, your application may crash.
If possible, use the QByteArray operator instead.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &bin(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::setIntegerBase(2) on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &bom(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Toggles insertion of the Byte Order Mark on stream when QTextStream is used with a UTF codec.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &center(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::setFieldAlignment(QTextStream::AlignCenter) on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &dec(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::setIntegerBase(10) on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &endl(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Writes '\n' to the stream and flushes the stream.
Equivalent to
Note: On Windows, all '\n' characters are written as '\r\n' if QTextStream's device or string is opened using the QIODevice::Text flag.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &fixed(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::setRealNumberNotation(QTextStream::FixedNotation) on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &flush(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::flush() on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &forcepoint(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::setNumberFlags(QTextStream::numberFlags() | QTextStream::ForcePoint) on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &forcesign(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::setNumberFlags(QTextStream::numberFlags() | QTextStream::ForceSign) on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &hex(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::setIntegerBase(16) on stream and returns stream.

db:note.db:para: The hex modifier can only be used for writing to streams.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &left(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::setFieldAlignment(QTextStream::AlignLeft) on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &lowercasebase(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::setNumberFlags(QTextStream::numberFlags() & ~QTextStream::UppercaseBase) on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &lowercasedigits(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::setNumberFlags(QTextStream::numberFlags() & ~QTextStream::UppercaseDigits) on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &noforcepoint(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::setNumberFlags(QTextStream::numberFlags() & ~QTextStream::ForcePoint) on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &noforcesign(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::setNumberFlags(QTextStream::numberFlags() & ~QTextStream::ForceSign) on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &noshowbase(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::setNumberFlags(QTextStream::numberFlags() & ~QTextStream::ShowBase) on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &oct(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::setIntegerBase(8) on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStreamManipulator qSetFieldWidth(int width)
db:section.db:para: Equivalent to QTextStream::setFieldWidth(width).

db:section.db:title: QTextStreamManipulator qSetPadChar(QChar ch)
db:section.db:para: Equivalent to QTextStream::setPadChar(ch).

db:section.db:title: QTextStreamManipulator qSetRealNumberPrecision(int precision)
db:section.db:para: Equivalent to QTextStream::setRealNumberPrecision(precision).

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &reset(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::reset() on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &right(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::setFieldAlignment(QTextStream::AlignRight) on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &scientific(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::setRealNumberNotation(QTextStream::ScientificNotation) on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &showbase(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::setNumberFlags(QTextStream::numberFlags() | QTextStream::ShowBase) on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &uppercasebase(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::setNumberFlags(QTextStream::numberFlags() | QTextStream::UppercaseBase) on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &uppercasedigits(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls QTextStream::setNumberFlags(QTextStream::numberFlags() | QTextStream::UppercaseDigits) on stream and returns stream.

db:section.db:title: QTextStream &ws(QTextStream &stream)
db:section.db:para: Calls skipWhiteSpace() on stream and returns stream.
